title: ProMedica Palliative Care - ProMedica Palliative Care

content.hospiceName: ProMedica Palliative Care Serving Northeast Ohio
content.counties: Medina, Portage, Stark, Summit
content.title: Coping With the Daily Challenges of a Serious Illness
content.description: Oftentimes, patients struggling under the burden of a serious illness could benefit from a higher level of consultation, management and involvement. We have developed a program to help meet these advanced medical care needs by providing a Nurse Practitioner working in conjunction with the primary physician to assess, treat and monitor a patient’s condition in the place considered home. This palliative service is focused on making a difference in the quality of our patients' lives and the lives of their loved ones by providing symptom management, goal planning and strengthening communication among all of the patient’s healthcare providers.

improvingLife.content: Minimizing the impact of serious illnesses is our primary focus. Our care team will work with you to develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

patientServices.content: Minimizing the impact of serious illnesses is our primary focus. Our care team will work with you to develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

whatIs.whatIsDescription:
What is Palliative Care
Making Each Day Better
Palliative care is specialized care for patients living with serious illnesses. It is patient-centered and focused on providing relief from the physical and emotional symptoms often associated with disease progression.

benefits.title: The Benefits of Palliative Care
benefits.content: Palliative care can be delivered in conjunction with curative care and treatment plans are created to match the goals of care expressed by the patient and family, regardless of the stage of disease. Using a multi-disciplinary approach, our specially trained team aims to improve quality of life for the patient, caregiver and family.

eligible.title: Who Is Eligible
eligible.content: Any individual who needs assistance with a serious, progressive illness such as lung disease, heart disease, cancer, chronic kidney disease, dementia, vascular disease and diabetes.

different.title: How Palliative Care is Different
different.content: Oftentimes, people don't understand the differences between palliative care and services offered through home health and hospice. The document linked below helps outline the differences in ProMedica's Palliative, Home Health and Hospice services.

patient.patientDescription:
Patient Services
Manage Your Symptoms
ProMedica Palliative Care helps during all stages of illness including while you are receiving treatment.

goals.title: You Determine Your Goals
goals.content: Working with your own medical provider, we provide an extra layer of education and support. We begin by learning about you and about what is important to you right now and as your illness progresses. In this way, together, we can develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

services.title: Symptoms Treated
list: Education about and completion of Advance Directives
Coordination across various care settings(transitions of care)

stories.storiesDescription:
Stories
The ProMedica Palliative Care Experience
Here are our stories, in the words of our patients, their families, and our care providers.

words.title: Words Of Appreciation
words.content: Our agency frequently receives recognition for the care we have provided to a patient or someone’s loved one. Many share their gratitude through letters or cards, and some tell us they don't have the words to describe their appreciation and simply say "Thanks."

improvingLife.content: Minimizing the impact of serious illnesses is our primary focus. Our care team will work with you to develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

whatIs.whatIsDescription:
What is Palliative Care
Making Each Day Better
Palliative care is specialized care for patients living with serious illnesses. It is patient-centered and focused on providing relief from the physical and emotional symptoms often associated with disease progression.

benefits.title: The Benefits of Palliative Care
benefits.content: Palliative care can be delivered in conjunction with curative care and treatment plans are created to match the goals of care expressed by the patient and family, regardless of the stage of disease. Using a multi-disciplinary approach, our specially trained team aims to improve quality of life for the patient, caregiver and family.

eligible.title: Who Is Eligible
eligible.content: Any individual who needs assistance with a serious, progressive illness such as lung disease, heart disease, cancer, chronic kidney disease, dementia, vascular disease and diabetes.

different.title: How Palliative Care is Different

whatIs.whatIsDescription:
What is Palliative Care
Making Each Day Better
Palliative care is specialized care for patients living with serious illnesses. It is patient-centered and focused on providing relief from the physical and emotional symptoms often associated with disease progression.

benefits.title: The Benefits of Palliative Care
benefits.content: Palliative care can be delivered in conjunction with curative care and treatment plans are created to match the goals of care expressed by the patient and family, regardless of the stage of disease. Using a multi-disciplinary approach, our specially trained team aims to improve quality of life for the patient, caregiver and family.

Using a multi-disciplinary approach, our specially trained team aims to improve quality of life for the patient, caregiver and family.

eligible.title: Who Is Eligible
eligible.content: Any individual who needs assistance with a serious, progressive illness such as lung disease, heart disease, cancer, chronic kidney disease, dementia, vascular disease and diabetes.

different.title: How Palliative Care is Different
different.content: Oftentimes, people don't understand the differences between palliative care and services offered through home health and hospice. The document linked below helps outline the differences in ProMedica's Palliative, Home Health and Hospice services.

patient.patientDescription:
Patient Services
Manage Your Symptoms
ProMedica Palliative Care helps during all stages of illness including while you are receiving treatment.

goals.title: You Determine Your Goals
goals.content: Working with your own medical provider, we provide an extra layer of education and support. We begin by learning about you and about what is important to you right now and as your illness progresses. In this way, together, we can develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

services.title: Symptoms Treated
list: Education about and completion of Advance Directives
Coordination across various care settings(transitions of care)

words.title: Words Of Appreciation
words.content: Our agency frequently receives recognition for the care we have provided to a patient or someone’s loved one. Many share their gratitude through letters or cards, and some tell us they don't have the words to describe their appreciation and simply say "Thanks."

content.hospiceName: ProMedica Palliative Care Serving Marin, Napa And Contra Costa Counties
content.counties: Napa, Marin, Contra Costa
content.title: Coping With the Daily Challenges of a Serious Illness
content.description: Oftentimes, patients struggling under the burden of a serious illness could benefit from a higher level of consultation, management and involvement. We have developed a program to help meet these advanced medical care needs by providing a Nurse Practitioner working in conjunction with the primary physician to assess, treat and monitor a patient’s condition in the place considered home. This palliative service is focused on making a difference in the quality of our patients' lives and the lives of their loved ones by providing symptom management, goal planning and strengthening communication among all of the patient’s healthcare providers.

improvingLife.content: Minimizing the impact of serious illnesses is our primary focus. Our care team will work with you to develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

Palliative care is specialized care for patients living with serious illnesses. It is patient-centered and focused on providing relief from the physical and emotional symptoms often associated with disease progression.

benefits.title: The Benefits of Palliative Care
benefits.content: Palliative care can be delivered in conjunction with curative care and treatment plans are created to match the goals of care expressed by the patient and family, regardless of the stage of disease. Using a multi-disciplinary approach, our specially trained team aims to improve quality of life for the patient, caregiver and family.

eligible.title: Who Is Eligible
eligible.content: Any individual who needs assistance with a serious, progressive illness such as lung disease, heart disease, cancer, chronic kidney disease, dementia, vascular disease and diabetes.

different.title: How Palliative Care is Different
different.content: Oftentimes, people don't understand the differences between palliative care and services offered through home health and hospice. The document linked below helps outline the differences in ProMedica's Palliative, Home Health and Hospice services.

patient.patientDescription:
Patient Services
Manage Your Symptoms
ProMedica Palliative Care helps during all stages of illness including while you are receiving treatment.

goals.title: You Determine Your Goals
goals.content: Working with your own medical provider, we provide an extra layer of education and support. We begin by learning about you and about what is important to you right now and as your illness progresses. In this way, together, we can develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

services.title: Symptoms Treated
list: Education about and completion of Advance Directives
Coordination across various care settings(transitions of care)

words.content: Our agency frequently receives recognition for the care we have provided to a patient or someone’s loved one. Many share their gratitude through letters or cards, and some tell us they don't have the words to describe their appreciation and simply say "Thanks."

What is Palliative Care
Making Each Day Better
Palliative care is specialized care for patients living with serious illnesses. It is patient-centered and focused on providing relief from the physical and emotional symptoms often associated with disease progression.

benefits.title: The Benefits of Palliative Care
benefits.content: Palliative care can be delivered in conjunction with curative care and treatment plans are created to match the goals of care expressed by the patient and family, regardless of the stage of disease. Using a multi-disciplinary approach, our specially trained team aims to improve quality of life for the patient, caregiver and family.

eligible.title: Who Is Eligible
eligible.content: Any individual who needs assistance with a serious, progressive illness such as lung disease, heart disease, cancer, chronic kidney disease, dementia, vascular disease and diabetes.

different.title: How Palliative Care is Different
different.content: Oftentimes, people don't understand the differences between palliative care and services offered through home health and hospice. The document linked below helps outline the differences in ProMedica's Palliative, Home Health and Hospice services.

patient.patientDescription:
Patient Services
Manage Your Symptoms
ProMedica Palliative Care helps during all stages of illness including while you are receiving treatment.

goals.title: You Determine Your Goals
goals.content: Working with your own medical provider, we provide an extra layer of education and support. We begin by learning about you and about what is important to you right now and as your illness progresses. In this way, together, we can develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individualized goals.

services.title: Symptoms Treated
list: Education about and completion of Advance Directives
Coordination across various care settings(transitions of care)

words.title: Words Of Appreciation
words.content: Our agency frequently receives recognition for the care we have provided to a patient or someone’s loved one. Many share their gratitude through letters or cards, and some tell us they don't have the words to describe their appreciation and simply say "Thanks."
